page.title: 04Local History.
page.content:
Leighton Farm Estate- continued
Mr. Naylor kept bison and kangaroos in the park near the Hall.Today unusual animals are still kept in the area. We saw a new baby llama at the Smithy. She was born on the day of the Derby horse-race, and named "Slip Anchor" after the winner. In 1931 the local County Council bought 500 acres of the farmland for smallholdings, and the Estate was split up. Many lodges and cottages in this area were built by the Naylors in the 1850's. {Employment}The Farm Estate buildings are now rented out to local firms and industries. These firms use the buildings at present:- Litho Link Printing, Kenton Jones Kitchens, Army surplus, local farmers, car re-spray and A.C. Roof Trusses.
